edu.rit.pj2.tracker

Class JobProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.tracker.JobProperties

  • public class JobProperties
extends Object
    Class JobProperties encapsulates the properties of a Job. The following properties may be specified:
    • workers — The number of worker tasks in a master-worker parallel for loop in the job.
    • masterSchedule — The schedule for a master-worker parallel loop in the job.
    • masterChunk — The chunk size for a master-worker parallel loop in the job.
    • threads — The number of threads executing parallel loops in a task in the job.
    • schedule — The schedule for parallel loops in a task in the job.
    • chunk — The chunk size for parallel loops in a task in the job.
    • nodeName — The name of the node on which to run a task in the job.
    • cores — The number of CPU cores needed to run a task in the job.
    • gpus — The number of GPU accelerators needed to run a task in the job.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL_CORES
      Indicates that the task requires all the cores on the node.
      static int ALL_GPUS
      Indicates that the task requires all the GPU accelerators on the node.
      static String ANY_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the task can run on any node of the cluster.
      static int DEFAULT_CHUNK
      Indicates that the masterChunk or chunk property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_CORES
      Indicates that the cores property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_GPUS
      Indicates that the gpus property is defaulted.
      static String DEFAULT_NODE_NAME
      Indicates that the nodeName property is defaulted.
      static Schedule DEFAULT_SCHEDULE
      Indicates that the masterSchedule or schedule property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_THREADS
      Indicates that the threads property is defaulted.
      static int DEFAULT_WORKERS
      Indicates that the workers property is defaulted.
      static int STANDARD_CHUNK
      Indicates to use the standard chunk size for the schedule property.
      static int THREADS_EQUALS_CORES
      Indicates that a parallel for loop will be executed by as many threads as there are cores on the machine.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobProperties

        public JobProperties()
        Construct a new job properties object. All settings are defaulted.

      • JobProperties

        public JobProperties(int workers,
             Schedule masterSchedule,
             int masterChunk,
             int threads,
             Schedule schedule,
             int chunk,
             String nodeName,
             int cores,
             int gpus)
        Construct a new job properties object with the given settings.
        Parameters:
        workers - Number of worker tasks for a master-worker parallel for loop, or DEFAULT_WORKERS.
        masterSchedule - Schedule for a master-worker parallel for loop, or DEFAULT_SCHEDULE.
        masterChunk - Chunk size for a master-worker parallel for loop, STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        threads - Number of threads for a parallel for loop, THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or DEFAULT_THREADS.
        schedule - Schedule for a parallel for loop, or DEFAULT_SCHEDULE.
        chunk - Chunk size for a parallel for loop, STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        nodeName - Node name on which a task must execute, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        cores - Number of CPU cores a task requires, ALL_CORES, or DEFAULT_CORES.
        gpus - Number of GPU accelerators a task requires, ALL_GPUS, or DEFAULT_GPUS.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if workers, masterChunk, threads, chunk, cores, or gpus is illegal.

    • Method Detail

      • workers

        public JobProperties workers(int workers)
        Set the workers property. The workers property specifies the number of worker tasks that will execute a master-worker parallel for loop.
        Parameters:
        workers - Number of worker tasks, or DEFAULT_WORKERS.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads is illegal.
        See Also:
        workers()

      • workers

        public int workers()
        Set the workers property. The workers property specifies the number of worker tasks that will execute a master-worker parallel for loop. If the workers property is defaulted, 1 is returned, indicating that a master-worker parallel for loop will be executed by one worker task.
        Returns:
        Number of worker tasks (≥ 1).
        See Also:
        workers(int)

      • masterSchedule

        public JobProperties masterSchedule(Schedule schedule)
        Set the masterSchedule property. The masterSchedule property, along with the masterChunk property, specifies how the iterations of a master-worker parallel for loop are partitioned among the worker tasks executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Parallel for loop schedule.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        See Also:
        masterSchedule(), masterChunk(int), masterChunk()

      • masterSchedule

        public Schedule masterSchedule()
        Get the masterSchedule property. The masterSchedule property, along with the masterChunk property, specifies how the iterations of a master-worker parallel for loop are partitioned among the worker tasks executing the parallel for loop. If the masterSchedule property is defaulted, a fixed schedule is returned.
        Returns:
        Parallel for loop schedule.
        See Also:
        masterSchedule(Schedule), masterChunk(int), masterChunk()

      • masterChunk

        public JobProperties masterChunk(int chunk)
        Set the masterChunk property. The masterChunk property, along with the masterSchedule property, specifies how the iterations of a master-worker parallel for loop are partitioned among the worker tasks executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        chunk - Chunk size (≥ 1), STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if chunk is illegal.
        See Also:
        masterSchedule(Schedule), masterSchedule(), masterChunk()

      • masterChunk

        public int masterChunk()
        Get the masterChunk property. The masterChunk property, along with the masterSchedule property, specifies how the iterations of a master-worker parallel for loop are partitioned among the worker tasks executing the parallel for loop. If the masterChunk property is defaulted, STANDARD_CHUNK is returned, indicating the standard chunk size for the masterSchedule property; see enum Schedule for further information.
        Returns:
        Chunk size (≥ 1), or STANDARD_CHUNK.
        See Also:
        masterSchedule(Schedule), masterSchedule(), masterChunk(int)

      • threads

        public JobProperties threads(int threads)
        Set the threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop.
        Parameters:
        threads - Number of threads (≥ 1), THREADS_EQUALS_CORES, or DEFAULT_THREADS.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if threads is illegal.
        See Also:
        threads()

      • threads

        public int threads()
        Get the threads property. The threads property specifies the number of threads that will execute a parallel for loop. If the threads property is defaulted, THREADS_EQUALS_CORES is returned, indicating that a parallel for loop will be executed by as many threads as there are cores on the machine.
        Returns:
        Number of threads (≥ 1), or THREADS_EQUALS_CORES.
        See Also:
        threads(int)

      • schedule

        public JobProperties schedule(Schedule schedule)
        Set the schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Parallel for loop schedule.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        See Also:
        schedule(), chunk(int), chunk()

      • schedule

        public Schedule schedule()
        Get the schedule property. The schedule property, along with the chunk property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If the schedule property is defaulted, a fixed schedule is returned.
        Returns:
        Parallel for loop schedule.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), chunk(int), chunk()

      • chunk

        public JobProperties chunk(int chunk)
        Set the chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. Refer to enum Schedule for descriptions of the possible schedules.
        Parameters:
        chunk - Chunk size (≥ 1), STANDARD_CHUNK, or DEFAULT_CHUNK.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if chunk is illegal.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), schedule(), chunk()

      • chunk

        public int chunk()
        Get the chunk property. The chunk property, along with the schedule property, specifies how the iterations of a parallel for loop are partitioned among the threads executing the parallel for loop. If the chunk property is defaulted, STANDARD_CHUNK is returned, indicating the standard chunk size for the schedule property; see enum Schedule for further information.
        Returns:
        Chunk size (≥ 1), or STANDARD_CHUNK.
        See Also:
        schedule(Schedule), schedule(), chunk(int)

        public JobProperties nodeName(String nodeName)
        Set the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which a task must run.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - Node name, ANY_NODE_NAME, or DEFAULT_NODE_NAME.
        Returns:
        This job properties object.
        See Also:
        nodeName()

      • nodeName

        public String nodeName()
        Get the nodeName property. The nodeName property specifies the name of the cluster node on which a task must run. If the nodeName property is defaulted, ANY_NODE_NAME is returned, indicating that a task can run on any node of the cluster.
        Returns:
        Node name, or ANY_NODE_NAME.
        See Also:
        nodeName(String)

        public int cores()

        Returns:
        Number of cores (≥ 1), or ALL_CORES.
        See Also:
        cores(int)

        Returns:
        This job properties object.

        See Also:
        gpus()

      • gpus

        public int gpus()
        Get the gpus property. The gpus property specifies the number of GPU accelerators a task requires. If the gpus property is defaulted, 0 is returned, indicating that a task requires no GPU accelerators.
        Returns:
        Number of GPUs (≥ 0).
        See Also:
        gpus(int)
